column5: I have no idea on the format of Canada Postal Codes, thought I would ask here.Are the postal codes format always - number, letter, number<space>number, letter, number?Is there any meaning that can be decifered from the code at a glance?Anything that could be shared would be educational for me. I'm being plagued by invalid postal code entry at my work, and I might be able to help our data setup actions have fewer erorrs if I knew anything about the Canada Postal Code system.

That format is not correct. The first three alphanumerals designate the province and/or sections of the province. The last three narrow it down further.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_codes_in_Canadahttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of...odes_in_Canada (you can click on each letter for a more detailed breakdown within each region)
Thanks Ad - exactly what I needed.
